messages.content: What are the requirements to use the ComfyUI-Deepface nodes?
To install the required dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
What are the two nodes included in the ComfyUI-Deepface library?
The two nodes are Deepface Extract Faces and Deepface Verify.
What does the Deepface Verify node do?

The Deepface Verify node given a set of input images and a set of reference (face) images, only outputs the input images with an average distance to the faces in the reference images less than or equal to a specified threshold. The output images are sorted by average distance to the reference image faces (nearest first).
What additional measures does the Deepface Verify node provide alongside the average distance?
In addition to distance, the node provides the ratio of reference images that each input image was verified to be a face match of, according to the default distance threshold of the model selected.
What does the output of the Deepface Verify node consist of?

The output of the Deepface Verify node consists of 'verified_images', 'verified_image_distances', 'verified_image_verified_ratios', 'rejected_images', 'rejected_image_distances', and 'rejected_image_verified_ratios'.
Can any individual output of the Deepface Verify node be 'None' and why?
Yes, any individual output may be 'None' if there are no input images matching the criteria.
Which project's nodes can be used to display the output distances?

Nodes from [was-node-suite-comfyui](https://github.com/WASasquatch/was-node-suite-comfyui) and [pythongosssss](https://github.com/pythongosssss/ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts) can be used to display the output distances.
